    1) From the text, list detected entity mentions with tentative ontology types.
    2) Propose up to k=6 candidate triples [subject, relation, object].

    VERY IMPORTANT:
    - You MUST include all explicit factual triples stated in the text, even if the relation,
      subject type, or object type is not listed in the ontology.
    - ALSO include ontology-valid triples whose domain/range matches the ontology relations.

    For each triple, include confidence ∈ [0,1] and cite the exact supporting span(s).

    Text
    "Addis Ababa Stadium and Addis Ababa City Hall are located in Addis Ababa in the country of Ethiopia."

    Ontology concepts
    - Building
- Organisation
- Tenant
- Architecture
- City
- Person
- Demonym
- Place
- Currency
- ArchitecturalStyle
- EthnicGroup
- Country
- Language
- State

    Ontology relations (domain → range)
    - governingBody(Building,Organisation)
- currentTenants(Building,Tenant)
- completionDate(Building,Date)
- architecture(Building,Architecture)
- capital(Building,City)
- chancellor(Building,Person)
- demonym(Building,Demonym)
- birthPlace(Building,Place)
- floorArea(Building,number)
- deathPlace(Building,Place)
- location(Building,Place)
- owner(Building,Person)
- currency(Building,Currency)
- tenant(Building,Tenant)
- origin(Building,Place)
- architecturalStyle(Building,ArchitecturalStyle)
- leaderTitle(Person,string)
- cost(Building,number)
- buildingStartDate(Building,Date)
- ethnicGroup(Building,ethnicGroup)
- addedToTheNationalRegisterOfHistoricPlaces(Building,Country)
- leader(Building,Person)
- isPartOf(Building,Organisation)
- region(Building,Place)
- yearOfConstruction(Building,Year)
- architect(Building,Person)
- inaugurationDate(Building,Date)
- foundationPlace(Building,Place)
- bedCount(Building,number)
- country(Building,Country)
- height(Building,number)
- floorCount(Building,number)
- language(Building,Language)
- state(Building,State)
- keyPerson(Building,Person)
- significantBuilding(Building,Building)
- address(Building,string)
- NationalRegisterOfHistoricPlacesReferenceNumber(Building,string)

    Output format (JSON only)
    {
      "mentions": [
        {"surface": "...", "type_candidates": ["ConceptA","ConceptB"], "span": [start,end]}
      ],
      "triples": [
        {
          "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
          "confidence": 0.0,
          "support": "exact quote from text",
          "notes": "why this triple is supported; if ontology applies, explain domain/range fit. If not in ontology, say 'not in ontology but supported by text'."
        }
      ]
    }

    Constraints
    - Extract ALL clearly stated factual triples in the text.
    - If a triple matches an ontology relation, enforce domain→range consistency and mention that in notes.
    - If a triple does NOT match any ontology relation, you MUST STILL include it (do not discard it).
    - Always extract any explicit date, time, or year mentioned in the text as part of a factual triple.
    - Resolve pronouns to the nearest valid antecedent and describe that in notes.
    - Do not invent entities that are not mentioned in the text.
    - Output MUST be valid JSON and nothing else.

    1) From the text, list detected entity mentions with tentative ontology types.
    2) Propose up to k=6 candidate triples [subject, relation, object].

    VERY IMPORTANT:
    - You MUST include all explicit factual triples stated in the text, even if the relation,
      subject type, or object type is not listed in the ontology.
    - ALSO include ontology-valid triples whose domain/range matches the ontology relations.

    For each triple, include confidence ∈ [0,1] and cite the exact supporting span(s).

    Text
    "Adisham Hall is located in Haputale was finished in 1931 and is in the Tudor Revival architectural style."

    Ontology concepts
    - Building
- Organisation
- Tenant
- Architecture
- City
- Person
- Demonym
- Place
- Currency
- ArchitecturalStyle
- EthnicGroup
- Country
- Language
- State

    Ontology relations (domain → range)
    - governingBody(Building,Organisation)
- currentTenants(Building,Tenant)
- completionDate(Building,Date)
- architecture(Building,Architecture)
- capital(Building,City)
- chancellor(Building,Person)
- demonym(Building,Demonym)
- birthPlace(Building,Place)
- floorArea(Building,number)
- deathPlace(Building,Place)
- location(Building,Place)
- owner(Building,Person)
- currency(Building,Currency)
- tenant(Building,Tenant)
- origin(Building,Place)
- architecturalStyle(Building,ArchitecturalStyle)
- leaderTitle(Person,string)
- cost(Building,number)
- buildingStartDate(Building,Date)
- ethnicGroup(Building,ethnicGroup)
- addedToTheNationalRegisterOfHistoricPlaces(Building,Country)
- leader(Building,Person)
- isPartOf(Building,Organisation)
- region(Building,Place)
- yearOfConstruction(Building,Year)
- architect(Building,Person)
- inaugurationDate(Building,Date)
- foundationPlace(Building,Place)
- bedCount(Building,number)
- country(Building,Country)
- height(Building,number)
- floorCount(Building,number)
- language(Building,Language)
- state(Building,State)
- keyPerson(Building,Person)
- significantBuilding(Building,Building)
- address(Building,string)
- NationalRegisterOfHistoricPlacesReferenceNumber(Building,string)

    Output format (JSON only)
    {
      "mentions": [
        {"surface": "...", "type_candidates": ["ConceptA","ConceptB"], "span": [start,end]}
      ],
      "triples": [
        {
          "triple": ["subject","relation","object"],
          "confidence": 0.0,
          "support": "exact quote from text",
          "notes": "why this triple is supported; if ontology applies, explain domain/range fit. If not in ontology, say 'not in ontology but supported by text'."
        }
      ]
    }

    Constraints
    - Extract ALL clearly stated factual triples in the text.
    - If a triple matches an ontology relation, enforce domain→range consistency and mention that in notes.
    - If a triple does NOT match any ontology relation, you MUST STILL include it (do not discard it).
    - Always extract any explicit date, time, or year mentioned in the text as part of a factual triple.
    - Resolve pronouns to the nearest valid antecedent and describe that in notes.
    - Do not invent entities that are not mentioned in the text.
    - Output MUST be valid JSON and nothing else.

triples.support: Adisham Hall is located in Haputale
triples.notes: ontology-valid triple; location(Building,Place)

triples.support: Adisham Hall is in the Tudor Revival architectural style
triples.notes: ontology-valid triple; architecture(Building,Architecture)

triples.support: Adisham Hall was finished in 1931
triples.notes: ontology-valid triple; completionDate(Building,Date)

triples.support: Adisham Hall is located in Haputale
triples.notes: not in ontology but supported by text; country(Building,Country)

triples.support: Adisham Hall is in the Tudor Revival architectural style
triples.notes: not in ontology but supported by text; yearOfConstruction(Building,Year)
